title: Non-overlapping Intervals
description:
Given an array of intervals, return the minimum number of intervals you need to remove to make the rest of the intervals non-overlapping.

Note: Intervals that touch at a single point are considered non-overlapping.

Example:
  Input: [[1,2],[2,3],[3,4],[1,3]]
  Output: 1 (remove [1,3])
test_code:
require_relative './solution'
require 'minitest/autorun'

class TestSolution < Minitest::Test
  def test_basic
    assert_equal 1, erase_overlap_intervals([[1, 2], [2, 3], [3, 4], [1, 3]])
  end

  def test_all_overlap
    assert_equal 2, erase_overlap_intervals([[1, 2], [1, 2], [1, 2]])
  end

  def test_no_overlap
    assert_equal 0, erase_overlap_intervals([[1, 2], [2, 3]])
  end
end
